Kelly McGillis Wikipedia

Her film career debuted in Reuben, Reuben in 1983. She had her breakthrough in the 1985 film Witness with Harrison Ford in her role as an Amish mother, for which she received Golden Globe and BAFTA award nominations.

Her other big role was that of flight instructor Charlie in the 1986 fighter-pilot film Top Gun with Tom Cruise and Val Kilmer. In 1987, McGillis acted in the fantasy-comedy film Made in Heaven, which also co-stars Oscar winner Timothy Hutton and was directed by Alan Rudolph, which was produced by Lorimar Productions.

Kelly appeared in Cat Chaser with Peter Weller, a film she despised and which discouraged her from pursuing an acting career. In 1992, she played the part of Babe Ruthâs second wife, Claire Merritt Ruth, in The Babe. From the late 1980s to the mid-1990s, she appeared in Winter People (1989), and North (1994), her 2nd Amish part in television or film, as well as several made-for-TV films.

In 1999, she co-starred with Val Kilmer (who plays Virgil, a blind man), for a second time as his overprotective sister in At First Sight. From 2000, McGillis played the suspect in the disappearance of a young woman starring Susie Porter in The Monkeyâs Mask, an international lesbian cult film. The film depends on the refrain novel of a similar name by Australian writer Dorothy Porter.

Kelly McGillis Stage Roles

McGillis appeared in a couple of off-broadway and Broadway theater productions during the 1980s in New York City. Through the mid-2000s, she was a featured actress at the prestigious Shakespeare Theatre Company in Washington DC. She appeared in a production of John Webberâs play âThe Duchess of Malfiâ at the Shakespeare Theatre, Washington, DC in 2002.

In 2004, McGillis appeared in the stage play The Graduate as Mrs. Robinson, touring the United States. In May 2009, McGillis starred in a Pasadena Playhouse stage production of The Little Foxes by Lillian Hellman, co-starring with Julia Duffy. She made an appearance in the production of Frankie and Johnny in the Clair de Lune by Terrence McNally, which toured the United Kingdom in 2010.

She joined the cast of Showtimeâs The L Word for its fifth season in 2007. In 2010, she starred alongside Nick Damici, Connor Paolo, and Danielle Harris in the vampire film Stake Land, directed by Jim Mickle. She starred in Ti Westâs 2011 thriller The Innkeepers. McGillis was featured in a breast cancer docu-drama titled 1 a Minute, which was released in 2010. She also had a lead role in Mother of All Secrets in 2017 as Rose Lewis.

Kelly McGillis June 2016 home invasion

On June 17, 2016, McGillis was left scratched and bruised after being reportedly assaulted by a woman who broke into her home in North Carolina. That attack, as well as others she has experienced in the past, led her to apply for a concealed carry gun permit to protect herself. Following the incident, Laurence Marie Dorn was charged and convicted of misdemeanor breaking and entering.

Kelly McGillis Top Gun

Top Gun is a 1986 American action drama film directed by Tony Scott and produced by Don Simpson and Jerry Bruckheimer, in collaboration with Paramount Pictures. On May 16, 1986, Top Gun was released in which McGillis appears as Charlotte âCharlieâ Blackwood. The character is based on Christine Fox, a real-life person, who worked at the Marine Corps Air Station Miramar.

The film won an Academy Award for Best Original Song for âTake My Breath Awayâ performed by Berlin. Subsequently, in 2015, the United States Library of Congress selected the film for preservation in the National Film Registry, finding it âculturally, historically, or aesthetically significantâ. A sequel, Top Gun: Maverick is scheduled for release on June 26, 2020.
